quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Voodoo and Religion
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, prelude, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In Voodoo, God is considered to be too distant for people to communicate with. Therefore, Voodoo priests communicate with God through Loa. What is Loa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The spirits

questions.question: The high Voodoo priest and priestess are often called this.

options.text: Son and Daughter of the Serpent

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Papa and Maman

questions.question: Voodoo rituals include animal sacrifice.
At Passover, Jews eat a special meal done in a special order.  What is that meal called?

options.text: A festavus for the rest of us

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A seder

questions.question: Voodoo is actually a religion, which originated in Africa. Voodoo comes from the West African word vodun. What does vodun mean?
Voodoos equivalent in Cuba is Santeria. Do you know which the equivalent of Voodoo in Brazil is?
Voodoo dolls are commonly used for voodoo.
The structure of Voodoo, as we know it today, was developed after the Europeans started slavery. Where was Voodoo born?
The International Red Garters are an organization of British traditional witches.
How is New Year referred to in Judaism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rosh Hashannah

questions.question: If I practice the Craft by myself,  not as part of a coven, I am said to be this.
Nowadays Voodoo is no longer a religion.
An eclectic witch strictly follows his or her chosen tradition.
The French rulers persecuted Voodoo priests and practitioners. In 1791 a revolution exploded, which was led by the Voodoo priests. It ended in the year of Napoleons crowning.
Voodoo Dancing is just a prelude to sexual frenzy.

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Judaism and Bible
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, gospel, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: We consider there to be three Patriarchs in Judaism. Who were they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham, Issac, Jacob

questions.question: Does the Bible ever speak of the sun moving backwards?
There was an army mentioned in the Old Testament that consisted of men who were all left-handed and numbered 700.
Which line gives the correct order of the first 5 books of the Old Testament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, Deuteronomy

questions.question: How many letters are in the hebrew alphabet?
How many vowels are in the Hebrew alphabet ?
Who was the Baal Shem Tov ?

options.text: The founder of the Bnai Brith

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The founder of Chassidism

questions.question: What is the traditional Jewish prayer book called?
On the first day of which month do Jews celebrate New Year?
Which Hebrew phrase is most commonly associated with the English expression Good Luck and/or Congratulations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mazel Tov

questions.question: In Judaism, who was Joshuas father?
The second chapter of the Gospel of Luke, Luke 2, tells us the story of Christs birth.
There is a man in the Bible named Rehoboam who had 88 children.
According to the second half of the Acts of the Apostles, what was Pauls name before God changed it?
In the Old Testament, a man is said to have lived to be 969 years old.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Torah and Night
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, toe, frog. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The most important prayer in Judaism is called the Shema. What does it affirm?

options.text: That we will not be moved
Our faith that there is one and only God.
That everyday problems will eventually solve if we have faith
We thank God for delivering us from at least some of our problems

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Our faith that there is one and only God.

questions.question: The night before Yom Kippur, called this,  is the most important night service in Judaism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kol Nidre

questions.question: Eye of newt and toe of frog

The movie An American Haunting was based on one of the most famous hauntings in American folklore. A Tennessee farmer shot at a strange animal with the body of a dog and the head of a rabbit.  What name was given to the entity that haunted the family and was said to have murdered the Tennessee farmer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bell Witch

questions.question: Do you think God knew what He was doing when he created woman? Or do you think it was another one of his minor mistakes like tidal waves, earthquakes or FLOODS!, asked Daryl Van Horne in The Witches of Eastwick. What actor played Daryl Van Horne, just your average horny little devil?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Nicholson

questions.question: The works of this Jewish thinker formed the basis of the writings of Thomas Aquinas.
What tribe of Israel was Moses born into?
What do Jews do when the case which houses the Torah is opened?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stand up

questions.question: Ding dong the witch is dead.

options.text: l you could see under the house was two shrivelled up legs and a pair of ruby slippers. Which wicked witchs demise brought forth such joy to the citizens of Oz in the book The Wizard of Oz?
The Wicked Witch of the West
The Wicked Witch of the North
The Wicked Witch of the South
The Wicked Witch of the East

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wicked Witch of the East

questions.question: Even when Jewish men are not reading Torah, they wear a garment with fringes with knots. It is worn under the shirt with the fringes exposed. What is this garment called ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tallit katan

questions.question: On the Holy Day of Yom Kippur, Jews ask that all their sins be forgiven.
What is the first letter of the Hebrew alphabet?
She held me spellbound in the night

options.text: d she drove herself to madness

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eagles

questions.question: What is prayer shawl worn by Jews in the morning Jewish services, during the Torah service, on Yom Kippur, and other holidays called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A tallit

questions.question: On which Holy Day do Jews feast on unleavened bread?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Buddha and Buddhism
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, immigrant, buddhist. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Creating complex, radial, and symbolic sand paintings is a practice typical for which branch of Buddhism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tibetan Buddhism

questions.question: The beginning of the Buddhist religion can be traced back to the fifth century BC in which country?
In 1927 Charles A. Levine was the first Jew to do what?

options.text: Get a degree in aerospace engineering

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fly the Atlantic

questions.question: Son of a Jewish immigrant from Breslau, Prussia, Lucius Nathan Littauer was born in Gloversville, Upstate New York, in 1859. Being a politician wasnt his only occupation; what is Lucius Littauers other achievement with which he remained in history?

options.text: The first Jewish  basketball coach in Oxford
The first professional Jewish baseball player
The first Jewish football coach at Harvard
The first Jewish professional football coach

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first Jewish football coach at Harvard

questions.question: After completing his religious reawakening, Buddha considered himself to be which of these?

options.text: a man, who woke up to the nature of reality
a prophet, sent by a supreme being to deliver the universal truth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a man, who woke up to the nature of reality

questions.question: What is the Japanese variation of Buddhism, that emphasizes on the role of sitting meditation in pursuing enlightenment?
There are two ways to pronounce Hebrew words. One is called Ashkanazi and the other one, this
What was the birth name of the historic figure known as Buddha, the founder of the Buddhist religion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Siddhartha Gautama

questions.question: Julius Vogel, a London born Jew, who first became involved in politics in 1862, was the first Jew to be on this political post.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prime Minister of New Zealand

questions.question: During the 1968 presidential campaign, Rabbi Baruch Korff developed a personal relationship with this American president, who even referred to Korff as My Rabbi.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Nixon

questions.question: What is the formula to end or reduce suffering according to the principles of Buddhism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Noble Eightfold Path

questions.question: What is the definition of Zen Koan, one of the important aspects of Buddhist religious practices?

options.text: A question, meant to challenge rational thinking
A clan of spiritual leaders in the Zen Buddhist religious community
A sitting pillow, used during mediation
An robe worn by Zen Buddhist monks

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A question, meant to challenge rational thinking

questions.question: What is the central theme of the teachings of religious teacher Buddha and of Buddhist philosophy as a whole?
These fundamental statements have led to the formulation of the Buddhist philosophy, and contain the basic principles of the spiritual teacher, Buddha.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Four Noble Truths

questions.question: Which of the following statements best describes the essence of Buddhism?

options.text: It is a means for people to save themselves.
It is the legacy of a prophet, sent to earth with a message of universal love.
It is a religion that seeks to attract and convert others.
It is a tradition aimed at spreading peace in the world.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a means for people to save themselves.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Patron and Saint
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, buddhist. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A famous and talented composer was almost bankrupt when he wrote one of his best-known works, Judas Maccabaeus - an oratorio based on a Jewish theme. Who was this classical composer?
Which saint is referred to as the patron of fishermen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew the Apostle

questions.question: Who is known as the patron of India?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Xavier

questions.question: Which saint is known as the patron of children?
Isachar Zacharie, an English born Jew, who was related to important American politicians, worked as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lincolns podiatrist

questions.question: Who was the first Italian-American woman to be canonized as a saint of the Catholic Church?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frances Cabrini

questions.question: In Buddhism the cycle of rebirths is known as what?
St. Benedict is known as the patron of which of these groups of people?
In what business did John M. Brunswick and his two half brothers, David and Emmanuel, make their fortune?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billiard table business

questions.question: Buddhist believe that this depends on the actions that we have taken in the past.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Our births

questions.question: What is Dharma?

options.text: The extinction of desire and individual consciousness

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The cosmic principles of existence

questions.question: Bodhisattva is consciously seeking what?
The music for Somewhere Over the Rainbow, one of the most famous and beloved songs of the late 1930s, was based on a Jewish Cantorial theme.
Why was Rabbi David Einhorn, a German rabbi and later leader of the Jewish reform movement in the United States, forced to leave Baltimore in 1861, during the Civil War?

options.text: He insulted the Governor of Maryland,Thomas Hicks
He insulted the Mayor of Baltimore, George Williams

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He preached against slavery

questions.question: Marty Glickman and Sam Stoller were great 100-yard runners in the 1930s. They were to be on the 4x100 meter relay race team for the USA in the 1936 Olympics, but eventually did not take part in the race. What was the reason?

options.text: They were late to the field
They refused to run on Saturday (Shabbos)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hitler demanded their exclusion

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Saint and Patron
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, ganesh, sanskrit. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which  saint is most often invoked for the recovery of a lost object?
What is the Hindu Trinity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vishnu, Brahma, Shiva

questions.question: What are the main characters of the ancient Sanskrit epic Ramayana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rama and Sita

questions.question: Lord Ganesh, one of the most worshipped divinities in Hinduism, has the head of what animal?
Which of these belonged to the highest-ranking Hindu caste?
Krishna is an incarnation of which Hindu god?
Who used to be the patron saint of travelers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Christopher

questions.question: Who is the patron saint of writers and librarians?
To which saint does one pray for healthy eyes?

options.text: St. Frances of the Holy Redeemer

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Lucy, Virgin

questions.question: Who is the founder of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, known as the Hare Krishna?
What is the most sacred river for Hindus?
The Swastika is a solar symbol for Hindus.
How many women-followers did the Hindu deity Lord Krishna have?
Hinduism is a monotheistic religion.
Which saint is the patron of all animals and living creatures?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francsis of Asissi
